00:00:01:150000.Speaker: Dr. Brian Greene
00:00:01:150000.Dialogue: My new book The Hidden Reality takes on a grand question: Is our universe the only universe? You see, there's a growing belief among scientists like me that ours may only be one among many universes populating a gigantic cosmos. In The Hidden Reality, I explore this possibility without presuming any knowledge of mathematics or physics on the part of the reader.

00:00:28:030000.Speaker: Amy
00:00:28:030000.Dialogue: I'm glad you talked me into this. We work so hard, sometimes, it's nice to goof off and do something silly.

00:00:33:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:33:010000.Dialogue: Agreed. Wait till you hear how he dumbs down Werner Heisenberg for the crowd. You may actually believe you're in a comedy club.

00:00:41:070000.Speaker: Greene
00:00:41:070000.Dialogue: You can think about Heisenberg's "uncertainty principle" much like the special order menu that you find in certain Chinese restaurants, where you have dishes in column A and other dishes in column B, and if you order the first dish in column A, you can't order the corresponding dish in column B. That's sort of like the "uncertainly principle."

00:01:03:000000.Speaker: Amy
00:01:03:000000.Dialogue: Say, I heard an interesting tidbit about Howard and Bernadette.

00:01:08:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:08:000000.Dialogue: Really, Amy? Gossip? I'm disappointed in you.

00:01:11:210000.Speaker: Amy
00:01:11:210000.Dialogue: Now, now. Evolutionary biologist Robin Dunbar has identified gossip as an aid to social bonding in large groups.

00:01:22:080000.Speaker: Amy
00:01:22:080000.Dialogue: What if he's right? And by not participating in gossip, society breaks down into small feral bands of tattooed motorcycle riders fighting to the death over the last few cans of tuna fish?

00:01:31:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:31:190000.Dialogue: Fine. In the parlance of the urban music scene, what's the 4-1-1?

00:01:37:210000.Speaker: Amy
00:01:37:210000.Dialogue: Bernadette is thinking about breaking up with Howard.

00:01:41:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:41:130000.Dialogue: I believe our nation's tuna cans are safe. Excuse me. Dr. Greene, question?

00:01:49:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:49:120000.Dialogue: You've dedicated your life's work to educating the general populace about complex scientific ideas.

00:01:56:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:56:170000.Dialogue: Have you ever considered trying to do something useful?

00:02:06:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:06:210000.Dialogue: Yeah, but not your books; something they might enjoy.

00:02:11:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:11:150000.Dialogue: I kid, of course. Big fan.

00:02:47:120000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing on a Nintendo Wii.
00:02:47:120000.Speaker: Leonard

00:02:51:000000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing on a Nintendo Wii.
00:02:51:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:51:000000.Dialogue: My father taught me archery as a child.

00:02:58:150000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing on a Nintendo Wii.
00:02:58:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:58:150000.Dialogue: It's odd how the activity brings back the smell of Kmart bourbon.

00:03:04:060000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing on a Nintendo Wii.
00:03:04:060000.Speaker: Leonard

00:03:11:150000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing on a Nintendo Wii.
00:03:11:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:11:150000.Dialogue: Whoo. What do you think you're doing?

00:03:14:000000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing on a Nintendo Wii.
00:03:14:000000.Speaker: Leonard

00:03:15:130000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing on a Nintendo Wii.
00:03:15:130000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:03:16:120000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing on a Nintendo Wii.
00:03:16:120000.Speaker: Leonard

00:03:21:150000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing on a Nintendo Wii.
00:03:21:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:21:150000.Dialogue: I'm not going to do that, Sheldon.

00:03:23:160000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing on a Nintendo Wii.
00:03:23:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:23:160000.Dialogue: Leonard, the people at Nintendo can only go so far in helping us recreate an actual athletic experience. We have to do our part, too.

00:03:38:150000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing on a Nintendo Wii.
00:03:38:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:38:150000.Dialogue: That was uncalled for, but... I'll play along. Ow.

00:03:47:190000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing on a Nintendo Wii.
00:03:47:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:47:190000.Dialogue: I had an unusual experience with Amy last night.

00:03:51:050000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing on a Nintendo Wii.
00:03:51:050000.Speaker: Leonard

00:03:55:090000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing on a Nintendo Wii.
00:03:55:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:55:090000.Dialogue: She was attempting to engage me in gossip.

00:03:58:230000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing on a Nintendo Wii.
00:03:58:230000.Speaker: Leonard

00:04:05:130000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing on a Nintendo Wii.
00:04:05:130000.Speaker: Leonard

00:04:07:070000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing on a Nintendo Wii.
00:04:07:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:07:070000.Dialogue: Oh, please, I was just pointing it out. I have no desire to engage in the activity.

00:04:11:220000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing on a Nintendo Wii.
00:04:11:220000.Speaker: Leonard

00:04:14:050000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing on a Nintendo Wii.
00:04:14:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:14:050000.Dialogue: All right, get this. Bernadette is thinking about breaking up with Howard.

00:04:21:070000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing on a Nintendo Wii.
00:04:21:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:21:070000.Dialogue: Oh... That's too bad. I wonder what happened.

00:04:24:180000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing on a Nintendo Wii.
00:04:24:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:24:180000.Dialogue: Mm, it's hard to say. I can only speculate based on the data I collected watching my parents' marriage implode. In that case, the woman dives into religion, while the man dives into a bottle-blonde bartender who tries to buy my love with action figures. Oop! Out of arrows.

00:04:53:110000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing on a Nintendo Wii.
00:04:53:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:53:110000.Dialogue: Boy, you sure get your money's worth out of these games.

00:05:12:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:12:150000.Dialogue: Sheldon doesn't allow flossing that close to the mirror.

00:05:16:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:16:180000.Dialogue: It's a splatter thing. There's a little piece of tape on the floor you're supposed to stand behind.

00:05:29:080000.Speaker: Priya
00:05:29:080000.Dialogue: You really need to let me take a look at that roommate agreement, one of these days.

00:05:33:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:33:040000.Dialogue: Mm, I don't know. I get a lawyer, he gets a lawyer... It's just easier to stand behind the tape.

00:05:39:120000.Speaker: Priya
00:05:39:120000.Dialogue: Oh, by the way, a fellow at work said I could use his Dodger tickets this weekend. Does that sound like fun?

00:05:48:020000.Speaker: Priya
00:05:48:020000.Dialogue: You'll need to explain the game to me.

00:05:50:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:50:040000.Dialogue: Mm, it's complicated. But as I remember it, the essentials are get chosen last, get hit by the ball, cry, go home.

00:05:57:000000.Speaker: Priya
00:05:57:000000.Dialogue: Well, regardless, I've got four tickets. And I was thinking we can bring Bernadette and Howard. She's really interesting, and I bet I can get used to him.

00:06:06:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:06:150000.Dialogue: Well, it might not be a great idea to invite those two.

00:06:10:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:10:230000.Dialogue: Don't tell anybody I told you, but I heard she might be breaking up with him.

00:06:14:190000.Speaker: Priya
00:06:14:190000.Dialogue: Oh... too bad... Although I do know one person for whom that's good news.

00:06:20:050000.Speaker: Priya
00:06:20:050000.Dialogue: My brother. He's got a big crush on Bernadette.

00:06:29:060000.Speaker: Priya
00:06:29:060000.Dialogue: No. I found poems he wrote about her. Very disturbing. Oh, Bernadette, please play my clarinet.

00:06:49:190000.Speaker: Priya
00:06:49:190000.Dialogue: Hmm. What's that piece of tape?

00:06:51:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:51:180000.Dialogue: Oh, that one doesn't apply to you. You sit. Hey. Hey.

00:06:59:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:59:060000.Dialogue: Not too bad. Did you hear about Howard and Bernadette?

00:07:01:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:01:100000.Dialogue: Course I heard about it. How did you hear about it?

00:07:03:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:03:090000.Dialogue: I heard about it from Sheldon. He got it from Amy.

00:07:05:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:05:050000.Dialogue: Oh, damn it. I told Amy that in the strictest confidence. Boy, some people are such blabbermouths. Well, whatever. I'm sure Bernadette can do better.

00:07:15:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:15:040000.Dialogue: Do you think a sexually ambivalent Indian astrophysicist with selective mutism and alcohol issues is better than a hundred-pound Jewish guy who lives with his mom?

00:07:24:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:24:190000.Dialogue: You are kidding. Raj likes Bernadette?

00:07:27:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:27:090000.Dialogue: I didn't say Raj. Who said Raj?

00:07:31:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:31:090000.Dialogue: Okay, give. How do you know? Did he tell you?

00:07:38:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:38:160000.Dialogue: Priya told you. What a little gossip. You know, not an attractive quality in a woman, Leonard. Not judging, just my opinion.

00:07:48:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:48:190000.Dialogue: Well, The point is, if this got out, it would destroy Howard and Raj's friendship.

00:07:52:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:52:230000.Dialogue: You don't have to worry. Unlike Amy and Priya, I know how to keep a secret.

00:07:57:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:57:150000.Dialogue: You're the one who told Amy in the first place.

00:08:07:100000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:07:100000.Dialogue: Hello, Mummy. Hello, Daddy. How are you?

00:08:10:170000.Speaker: Mrs Koothrappali
00:08:10:170000.Dialogue: We're very rich in a very poor country. So, all in all, can't complain.

00:08:15:120000.Speaker: Dr Koothrappali
00:08:15:120000.Dialogue: So, Priya, how are enjoying staying with your brother?

00:08:20:060000.Speaker: Priya
00:08:20:060000.Dialogue: It's fine. But if I'm going to stay in Los Angeles much longer, I think I should get my own place.

00:08:25:020000.Speaker: Mrs Koothrappali
00:08:25:020000.Dialogue: Why? Is Rajesh not making you feel comfortable? Rajesh, why aren't you making your sister comfortable?

00:08:31:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:31:040000.Dialogue: I am making her comfortable. Besides, she's not sleeping here half the time anyw...

00:08:38:160000.Speaker: Dr Koothrappali
00:08:38:160000.Dialogue: What? Where are you sleeping, Priya?

00:08:41:100000.Speaker: Priya
00:08:41:100000.Dialogue: It's a figure of speech, Daddy. It means I-I work late.

00:08:46:200000.Speaker: Mrs Koothrappali
00:08:46:200000.Dialogue: Please tell me you're not dating an American. I knew this would happen. Rajesh, are you letting your sister date that little Howard boy?

00:08:53:220000.Speaker: Dr Koothrappali
00:08:53:220000.Dialogue: Now, hold on. If she is dating an American, that's not a bad way to go. He's Jewish. Those chaps are very successful, and they don't drink a lot.

00:09:03:210000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:03:210000.Dialogue: It-It doesn't matter. Howard has a girlfriend.

00:09:09:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:09:020000.Dialogue: Is something going on with him and Bernadette?

00:09:13:080000.Speaker: Mrs Koothrappali
00:09:13:080000.Dialogue: You can't tell by that. Winona Ryder is Jewish.

00:09:18:230000.Speaker: Dr Koothrappali
00:09:18:230000.Dialogue: Okay, we're getting off the subject. Rajesh, I want you to try harder to make your sister feel welcome.

00:09:25:210000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:25:210000.Dialogue: Don't worry. Everything I have, I share with her. Including my friend Leon...

00:09:29:100000.Speaker: Priya
00:09:29:100000.Dialogue: Good night, Mummy. Good night, Daddy.

00:09:33:120000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:33:120000.Dialogue: Oh, my God, I think you broke my toe!

00:09:37:050000.Speaker: Priya
00:09:37:050000.Dialogue: You should have kept your mouth shut.

00:09:39:100000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:39:100000.Dialogue: Fair enough. Now, what's up with Clarinet...? Bernadette!

00:09:48:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:48:150000.Dialogue: I've been thinking about Dr. Greene's efforts to make science palatable for the masses.

00:09:55:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:55:120000.Dialogue: That's all. I've just been thinking about it.

00:10:00:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:00:050000.Dialogue: Now, I'm thinking about fractal equations.

00:10:04:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:04:160000.Dialogue: Now I'm thinking about the origin of the phrase "train of thought." Now I'm thinking about trains.

00:10:13:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:10:13:040000.Dialogue: Are you listening to this guy?

00:10:15:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:15:180000.Dialogue: Hmm? Oh, I'm sorry. I was somewhere else.

00:10:30:130000.Speaker: Raj
00:10:30:130000.Dialogue: Oh, no. I hope everything's okay.

00:10:36:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:36:100000.Dialogue: Whatever it is, we're here for you. You can tell us anything.

00:10:45:110000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:45:110000.Dialogue: I'm gonna ask her to marry me.

00:10:58:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:58:190000.Dialogue: Oh, great. It's my cousin David about the ring. Hey, David, what'd you find? Sure, a half a caret's fine. Her freakishly small hands make anything look big.

00:11:10:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:10:040000.Dialogue: It's one of the reasons I love her.

00:11:13:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:13:210000.Dialogue: Man, he's going to be blindsided.

00:11:28:000000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:28:000000.Dialogue: Uh, a smile means something different in my country. You know, tears of joy, smile of sadness. India's a goofy place.

00:11:40:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:40:010000.Dialogue: Oh, I'm back to trains. Woo-woo.

00:11:49:120000.Speaker: Amy
00:11:49:120000.Dialogue: Did I tell you our lab got a grant to study addiction?

00:11:59:210000.Speaker: Amy
00:11:59:210000.Dialogue: Yes. He looks much cooler than the non-smoking monkeys.

00:12:04:180000.Speaker: Amy
00:12:04:180000.Dialogue: Although it's not much of a contest. The other monkeys just sit around and masturbate.

00:12:12:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:12:150000.Dialogue: If you don't mind, I'd like to stop listening to you and start talking.

00:12:19:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:19:200000.Dialogue: Howard has announced his intention to propose marriage to Bernadette.

00:12:24:110000.Speaker: Amy
00:12:24:110000.Dialogue: I don't understand. The original piece of gossip indicated an impending breakup.

00:12:28:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:28:150000.Dialogue: I know. The group consensus is that his proposal will be met with an humiliating, soul-crushing rejection. Everyone was set a-twitter. Although oddly, no one tweeted.

00:12:44:080000.Speaker: Amy
00:12:44:080000.Dialogue: It's not surprising that the story has captured the attention of our little circle of friends. Are you familiar with meme theory?

00:12:49:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:49:200000.Dialogue: I'm familiar with everything, but go on.

00:12:52:100000.Speaker: Amy
00:12:52:100000.Dialogue: Meme theory suggests that items of gossip are like living things that seek to reproduce using humans as their host.

00:13:00:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:00:030000.Dialogue: I'm no stranger to memetic epidemiology. At Johnson Elementary School, the phrase "Shelly Cooper's a smelly pooper" spread like wildfire.

00:13:10:010000.Speaker: Amy
00:13:10:010000.Dialogue: I should think so. That's gold.

00:13:17:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:17:180000.Dialogue: Your meme hypothesis does intrigue me. How might we examine this more closely?

00:13:23:210000.Speaker: Amy
00:13:23:210000.Dialogue: Do you have any ethical qualms regarding human experimentation?

00:13:27:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:27:180000.Dialogue: It's one of the few forms of interaction with people that I don't find repellent.

00:13:32:170000.Speaker: Amy
00:13:32:170000.Dialogue: We need to fabricate a tantalizing piece of gossip.

00:13:36:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:36:040000.Dialogue: And a second non-tantalizing piece to use as a control.

00:13:40:140000.Speaker: Amy
00:13:40:140000.Dialogue: Then we'll track its progress through our social group and interpret the results through the competing academic prisms of memetic theory, algebraic gossip and epidemiology.

00:13:48:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:48:210000.Dialogue: Look at you, getting me to engage in the social sciences.

00:13:55:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:55:130000.Dialogue: You're a vixen, Amy Farrah Fowler.

00:14:06:060000.Speaker: Amy
00:14:06:060000.Dialogue: Sheldon and I engaged in sexual intercourse. In other news, I'm thinking of starting an herb garden. Mum's the word. Gotta go.

00:14:16:230000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:14:16:230000.Dialogue: Oh, hey, Raj, what are you doing here?

00:14:19:190000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:19:190000.Dialogue: I just felt like drinking alone, because I'm deep and dark.

00:14:24:160000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:14:24:160000.Dialogue: Uh-huh. So, uh, Howard's not here?

00:14:27:210000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:27:210000.Dialogue: No. It's just one of those times when it's just you and me. Like when the three of us went to the movies, and you and I waited outside the bathroom while Howard threw up Red Vines and Cherry Coke.

00:14:53:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:53:200000.Dialogue: What the hell are you doing? Howard is your best friend, and that is his girlfriend. You should be ashamed of yourself.

00:14:58:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:58:200000.Dialogue: I was when I came in, but it's amazing what liquor does to guilt. Besides what you might not know is Bernadette is planning on breaking up with Howard.

00:15:10:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:10:020000.Dialogue: Oh, that gossipy bitch. No offense.

00:15:15:090000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:15:090000.Dialogue: None taken. You should hear how she talks about you.

00:15:20:000000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:20:000000.Dialogue: Okay, listen, just because Howard and Bernadette are having problems, does not mean you should be here sniffing around.

00:15:24:080000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:24:080000.Dialogue: What can I do? I can't stop thinking about her.

00:15:27:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:27:170000.Dialogue: All right, try thinking about this-- Sheldon and Amy had sex.

00:15:40:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:40:060000.Dialogue: Yeah, it's true. Amy told me.

00:15:41:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:41:200000.Dialogue: How did that even happen? Did they know that's what they were doing when they were doing it?

00:15:47:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:47:140000.Dialogue: I-I guess they just figured it out at some point.

00:15:49:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:49:230000.Dialogue: Wow. I can't believe old Smelly Pooper finally got laid.

00:16:00:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:00:230000.Dialogue: Interesting. A friendly sentiment in this country, cruel taunt in the Sudan.

00:16:12:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:12:180000.Dialogue: Will Amy be joining us for dinner?

00:16:16:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:16:100000.Dialogue: Good, good. Everything... okay between you two?

00:16:31:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:31:020000.Dialogue: No reason. I was just talking to Raj, and he mentioned what a lovely glow she has these days.

00:16:40:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:40:080000.Dialogue: Did he mean as if she'd been out in the sun, tending an herb garden without wearing a hat or sunblock?

00:16:49:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:49:070000.Dialogue: No. That's not what he meant.

00:16:54:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:54:190000.Dialogue: Well, we may never know. As my mother would say, the Asians are an inscrutable folk.

00:17:04:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:04:210000.Dialogue: Now, if you'll excuse me, I have work to do.

00:17:07:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:07:070000.Dialogue: Yeah, you do. You dog, you.

00:17:17:190000.Speaker: Amy
00:17:17:190000.Dialogue: Every word. Our false gossip meme appears to have reached node lambda.

00:17:23:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:23:020000.Dialogue: This is moving faster than we thought.

00:17:24:040000.Speaker: Amy
00:17:24:040000.Dialogue: Agreed. It appears the rate of gossip transmission is proportional to the number of nodes squared.

00:17:29:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:29:110000.Dialogue: I must say, Amy, pretending to have intercourse with you is giving me a great deal of satisfaction.

00:17:37:230000.Speaker: Amy
00:17:37:230000.Dialogue: Slow down, Sheldon. I'm not quite there yet.

00:17:45:160000.Speaker: Amy
00:17:45:160000.Dialogue: Bernadette just asked about my sexual encounter with you. The meme has reached full penetration.

00:18:00:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:00:020000.Dialogue: This is remarkable. Took less than 24 hours.

00:18:05:010000.Speaker: Amy
00:18:05:010000.Dialogue: I should let you know that she asked for details about our dalliance.

00:18:09:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:09:050000.Dialogue: Interesting. So it went beyond the mere fact of coitus to a "blow by blow," as it were.

00:18:22:130000.Speaker: Amy
00:18:22:130000.Dialogue: Not important. I described your lovemaking as "aloof, but effective."

00:18:29:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:29:170000.Dialogue: I wish you hadn't done that. That's going to make me a chick magnet, and I'm so busy as it is.

00:18:38:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:38:210000.Dialogue: Hey, everybody, I got something I want to ask Bernadette, and I can't think of a better time than when I'm with all my friends.

00:18:47:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:47:040000.Dialogue: Oh, hold on, Howard. There's lots of better times.

00:18:51:210000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:51:210000.Dialogue: Leonard, please. The man is talking. Let him get it out, and let the chips fall where they may.

00:19:06:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:06:180000.Dialogue: I know things haven't been perfect with us, and we've had our problems, but I just have to tell you, from the moment I...

00:19:14:070000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:19:14:070000.Dialogue: Howard, let me just stop you right here.

00:19:32:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:32:050000.Dialogue: Oh, I love you so much.

00:19:42:210000.Speaker: Amy
00:19:42:210000.Dialogue: I wonder what changed her mind.

00:19:45:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:45:070000.Dialogue: Perhaps your talk of my sexual prowess renewed her faith in love.

00:19:50:140000.Speaker: Amy
00:19:50:140000.Dialogue: As good an explanation as any.

00:20:00:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:20:00:230000.Dialogue: Oh, hey, Amy. Bernadette just texted me. Howard proposed?

00:20:04:120000.Speaker: Amy
00:20:04:120000.Dialogue: Yes, not important. Just stopped by to let you know I'm getting orthotics. Also, I'm carrying Sheldon's baby. Mum's the word.

00:20:16:130000.Scene: The stairwell, moments later. Leonard is reading a text message.
00:20:16:130000.Speaker: Leonard

00:20:20:210000.Scene: The stairwell, moments later. Leonard is reading a text message.
00:20:20:210000.Speaker: Amy
00:20:20:210000.Dialogue: Wow. Is there anything on there about orthotics?
